original: @261b ` // sa dang shing dang rdo'i cho ga bzhugs /
analyzed: @261b ` // sa dang shing dang rdo'i cho ga bzhugs /
translated: The ritual of earth, wood, and stone.

original: * // dpal rdo rje sems dpa' la phyag 'tshal lo //
analyzed: * // dpal rdo rje sems dpa' la phyag 'tshal lo //
translated: Homage to glorious Vajrasattva.

original: lha yi rnal 'byor dang ldan pas //
analyzed: lha yi rnal 'byor dang ldan pas //
translated: Endowed with the yoga of the deity,

original: sa gzhi mchod pa mchog bsgrubs te //
analyzed: sa gzhi mchod pa mchog bsgrubs te //
translated: one should accomplish the supreme worship of the ground.

original: lha las ldang bar byas nas ni //
analyzed: lha las ldang bar byas nas ni //
translated: Having arisen from the deity,

original: de nas sa gzhi sbyar bar bya //
analyzed: de nas sa gzhi sbyar bar bya //
translated: then one should prepare the ground.

original: de la slob dpon gyis rang gi 'dod pa'i lha'i rnal 'byor byas te mtshan mo'i dus su gzhon nu ma gcig gdong shar du phyogs pa la mchod pa byas te bstod nas /
analyzed: de la slob dpon gyis rang gi 'dod pa'i lha'i rnal 'byor byas te mtshan mo'i dus su gzhon nu ma gcig gdong shar du phyogs pa la mchod pa byas te bstod nas /
translated: There, the master, having performed the yoga of his chosen deity, at night, facing east, should worship and praise a maiden.

original: kye bcom ldan 'das ma dge ba dang mi dge ba smros shig ces brjod de /
analyzed: kye bcom ldan 'das ma dge ba dang mi dge ba smros shig ces brjod de /
translated: Then he should say, O Bhagavatƒ´, speak of virtue and non-virtue.

original: aa / ka /üîΩpa / ta /
analyzed: aa / ka / pa / ta /
translated: The syllables a, ka,üîΩpa, ta,

original: tsa / sa /
analyzed: tsa / sa /
translated: ca, ·π≠a,üîΩta, tha,

original: ha / ba /
analyzed: ha / ba /
translated: da, dha,

original: dza rnams tshig gi thog mar byung ba'i de'i brjod pa ma 'khrul par rjes su dpag par bya'o //
analyzed: dza rnams tshig gi thog mar byung ba'i de'i brjod pa ma 'khrul par rjes su dpag par bya'o //
translated: na should be inferred without error in their utterance when they occur at the beginning of words.

original: de mig dgu pa'i sa rnams la der gal te byang du aa yi ga thog mar gyur pa de'i tshe nges par shar gyi phyogs su rkang pas lhag pa'i khru gang gi 'og na srog chags gnyis kyi zug rdu'o //
analyzed: de mig dgu pa'i sa rnams la der gal te byang du aa yi ga thog mar gyur pa de'i tshe nges par shar gyi phyogs su rkang pas lhag pa'i khru gang gi 'og na srog chags gnyis kyi zug rdu'o //
translated: If the first letter of the name is A, then there will be a pain of two creatures one cubit below the eastern foot.

original: de ma phyung na rigs rgyud dang rang gi chung ma 'chi ba dang me'i 'jigs pa'i skyon 'byung ngo //
analyzed: de ma phyung na rigs rgyud dang rang gi chung ma 'chi ba dang me'i 'jigs pa'i skyon 'byung ngo //
translated: If it is not extracted, there will be the fault of the death of the family and one's wife, and the danger of fire.

original: ka dang por brjod na byang du me'i zug rngu ste rgyal rigs kyi rus pa rkang pa gnyis kyis lhag pa'i khru gang gi 'og na yod do //
analyzed: ka dang por brjod na byang du me'i zug rngu ste rgyal rigs kyi rus pa rkang pa gnyis kyis lhag pa'i khru gang gi 'og na yod do //
translated: If the first letter is Ka, then there will be a pain of fire in the north, and the bone of the warrior caste will be found two cubits below the two feet.

original: de gal te ma phyung na de'i tshe nad sna tshogs dang / me'i 'jigs pa dang don nyams pa rgyal pos gzir ba rab tu 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de gal te ma phyung na de'i tshe nad sna tshogs dang / me'i 'jigs pa dang don nyams pa rgyal pos gzir ba rab tu 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If it is not extracted, then various illnesses, the danger of fire, loss of wealth, and being oppressed by the king will occur.

original: pa dang por brjod na byang dang lho'i phyogs su rkang pas dman pa'i khru gnyis kyi 'og na rje'u rigs kyi rus pa'i dum @262a * //
analyzed: pa dang por brjod na byang dang lho'i phyogs su rkang pas dman pa'i khru gnyis kyi 'og na rje'u rigs kyi rus pa'i dum @262a * //
translated: If the first letter is Pa, then two cubits below the northern and southern directions there will be a piece of the bone of the merchant caste.

original: bu'o // de ma phyung na phyi dang nang du tsha gdung dang don nyams par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bu'o // de ma phyung na phyi dang nang du tsha gdung dang don nyams par 'gyur ro //
translated: If it is not extracted, there will be heat and pain inside and outside, and loss of wealth.

original: ta dang po dang phyi mar brjod na srin po'i phyogs na dmangs rigs kyi rus pa'i dum bu mtho gnyis kyi 'og na'o //
analyzed: ta dang po dang phyi mar brjod na srin po'i phyogs na dmangs rigs kyi rus pa'i dum bu mtho gnyis kyi 'og na'o //
translated: If the first and last are pronounced, in the direction of the rakshasas, there is a fragment of bone of the sudra caste two cubits below.

original: de gal te ma phyung na da'i tshe nad sna tshogs kyis gzir ba dang me'i 'jigs pa dang khyim gyi bdag po 'chi'o //
analyzed: de gal te ma phyung na da'i tshe nad sna tshogs kyis gzir ba dang me'i 'jigs pa dang khyim gyi bdag po 'chi'o //
translated: If it is not extracted, at that time one is afflicted by various diseases, there is the danger of fire, and the head of the household will die.

original: tsa dang por brjod na chu'i phyogs su bram ze'i rus pa'i zug rdu rkang pas lhag pa'i khru gnyis kyi 'og na'o //
analyzed: tsa dang por brjod na chu'i phyogs su bram ze'i rus pa'i zug rdu rkang pas lhag pa'i khru gnyis kyi 'og na'o //
translated: If the first is pronounced, in the direction of water, there is a splinter of bone of the brahmin caste two cubits above the foot.

original: de ma phyung na khyim mes 'jig par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ma phyung na khyim mes 'jig par 'gyur ro //
translated: If it is not extracted, the house will be destroyed by fire.

original: sa dang po dang phyi mar yod na rlung gi phyogs su sa'i bdag po'i rgyud kyi rus pa'i zug rdu 'byung ste phyed dang bcas pa'i mtho gnyis kyi 'og nas so //
analyzed: sa dang po dang phyi mar yod na rlung gi phyogs su sa'i bdag po'i rgyud kyi rus pa'i zug rdu 'byung ste phyed dang bcas pa'i mtho gnyis kyi 'og nas so //
translated: If it is in the first and last, in the direction of wind, there is a splinter of bone of the lord of the earth caste two cubits below the half.

original: de ma phyung na mdza' ba yun thung ba nyid dang mya ngan du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ma phyung na mdza' ba yun thung ba nyid dang mya ngan du 'gyur ro //
translated: If it is not extracted, there will be a short life span and grief.

original: ha dang por brjod na byang gi phyogs su rkang pa gsum gyis lhag pa'i khru gnyis kyi 'og na rje'u rigs kyi skye bo'i rus pa'i zug rdu ste 'dis ni skyes pa dang bud med rnams tshe thung ba nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ha dang por brjod na byang gi phyogs su rkang pa gsum gyis lhag pa'i khru gnyis kyi 'og na rje'u rigs kyi skye bo'i rus pa'i zug rdu ste 'dis ni skyes pa dang bud med rnams tshe thung ba nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: If the first syllable is ha, two cubits below the northern direction, there is a bone splinter of the warrior caste. This causes men and women to have short lives.

original: ba yig dang po dang phyi mar yod na dbang ldan du mtho gsum na dmangs rigs kyi rus pa'o //
analyzed: ba yig dang po dang phyi mar yod na dbang ldan du mtho gsum na dmangs rigs kyi rus pa'o //
translated: If the first and last syllables are ba, in the northeast direction, three cubits above, there is a bone of the low caste.

original: yang na byi la'i rus pa dang lcags dang sol ba yod do //
analyzed: yang na byi la'i rus pa dang lcags dang sol ba yod do //
translated: Alternatively, there is the bone of a cat, iron, and charcoal.

original: de ma phyung bar bzhag na rgyud kyi nor nyams par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ma phyung bar bzhag na rgyud kyi nor nyams par 'gyur ro //
translated: If it is not extracted, the wealth of the family will decline.

original: dza dang po dang phyi mar brjod na de'i dbus na bram ze'i rus pa'i zur rdu ste de ma phyung na rgyal po'i chad pas gzir ba dang nor zad pa'i skyon 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dza dang po dang phyi mar brjod na de'i dbus na bram ze'i rus pa'i zur rdu ste de ma phyung na rgyal po'i chad pas gzir ba dang nor zad pa'i skyon 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If the first and last syllables are ja, in the middle of that, there is a bone splinter of the brahmin caste. If it is not extracted, the fault of being punished by the king and the loss of wealth will occur.

original: de'i phyir thams cad du nyes pa du ma 'byung ba'i phyir zug rdu rnams dbyung bar bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir thams cad du nyes pa du ma 'byung ba'i phyir zug rdu rnams dbyung bar bya'o //
translated: Therefore, because many faults occur everywhere, the splinters should be extracted.

original: de nas gzhon nu ma mchod de mdun du yungs kar dkar po dang nim pa'i lo ma la sogs pa g-yas pa'i khu tshur gyis g-yas su bskor zhing g-yon pa'i khu tshur gyis g-yon du bskor nas me la lan gsum du dor bar bya'o //
analyzed: de nas gzhon nu ma mchod de mdun du yungs kar dkar po dang nim pa'i lo ma la sogs pa g-yas pa'i khu tshur gyis g-yas su bskor zhing g-yon pa'i khu tshur gyis g-yon du bskor nas me la lan gsum du dor bar bya'o //
translated: Then, having worshipped the young girl, one should throw white mustard seeds and neem leaves, etc., into the fire with one‚Äôs right hand, turning to the right, and with one‚Äôs left hand, turning to the left, three times.

original: sngags ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: sngags ni 'di yin te /
translated: The mantra is:

original: aom sarba p'a pa da ha na badzra sarba p'a bam da ha sv'a h'a /
analyzed: aom sarba p'a pa da ha na badzra sarba p'a bam da ha sv'a h'a /
translated: O·πÉ, burn, burn all evil with the vajra! Burn all evil! SvƒÅhƒÅ!

original: de nas aarka'i ras bal gyis mar me'i sdong bu byas te /
analyzed: de nas aarka'i ras bal gyis mar me'i sdong bu byas te /
translated: Then, having made a wick with arka cotton,

original: til nag po'i snum gyis mar me spar te zug rdu brtag par bya'o //
analyzed: til nag po'i snum gyis mar me spar te zug rdu brtag par bya'o //
translated: one should light the lamp with black sesame oil and examine the pain.

original: de la phyogs gang du mar me'i rtse mo rgyug pa der nges par zug rdu yod do zhes rtogs par bya'o //
analyzed: de la phyogs gang du mar me'i rtse mo rgyug pa der nges par zug rdu yod do zhes rtogs par bya'o //
translated: One should understand that wherever the tip of the lamp moves, there is definitely a pain.

original: gang du mar me rdul gyis bskor ba der zug rdur 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gang du mar me rdul gyis bskor ba der zug rdur 'gyur ro //
translated: Where the lamp is surrounded by sparks, there will be a pain.

original: de nas gtor ma dang mchod @262b pa la sogs pa byas nas me tog dang bcas pa'i 'bras yos sa la gtor bar bya'o /
analyzed: de nas gtor ma dang mchod @262b pa la sogs pa byas nas me tog dang bcas pa'i 'bras yos sa la gtor bar bya'o /
translated: Then, having made offerings, etc., one should scatter rice with flowers on the ground.

original: // / shing gi las zhes gsungs pa de brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: // / shing gi las zhes gsungs pa de brjod par bya'o //
translated: The work of the carpenter should be mentioned.

original: nags kyi 'khrul 'khor de 'dren pa //
analyzed: nags kyi 'khrul 'khor de 'dren pa //
translated: The carpenter should be summoned to the forest.

original: mkhas pas yang dag blangs nas ni //
analyzed: mkhas pas yang dag blangs nas ni //
translated: The wise one should take him properly

original: shing gi mgo bor legs bzhag ste ;
analyzed: shing gi mgo bor legs bzhag ste ;
translated: and place him well at the head of the tree.

original: / bdud rtsi'i me la sbyin sreg bya //
analyzed: / bdud rtsi'i me la sbyin sreg bya //
translated: He should be offered oblations in the fire of nectar.

original: de la tshes dang gza' dang rgyu skar bzad po la mchod rten bzhengs pa dang gtsug lag khang la sogs pa'i mchod sdod dang / sgo dang / ka ba la sogs pa shing gi rtse mo'i mthar thug pa rnams kyi chu dang zheng dag phya mkhan dang thig skud 'dzin pa la sogs pa rnams kyis yang dag par brtags te /
analyzed: de la tshes dang gza' dang rgyu skar bzad po la mchod rten bzhengs pa dang gtsug lag khang la sogs pa'i mchod sdod dang / sgo dang / ka ba la sogs pa shing gi rtse mo'i mthar thug pa rnams kyi chu dang zheng dag phya mkhan dang thig skud 'dzin pa la sogs pa rnams kyis yang dag par brtags te /
translated: There, on an auspicious lunar day, under a favorable planet and star, the carpenter and the measurer, etc. should properly measure the height and width of the trees, up to the top, for the construction of a stupa, a temple, doors, pillars, etc.

original: shing bzo ba'i 'khor rnams tshogs pa dang mchod sbyin byed pa'i slob dpon dag dang lhan cig nags su 'khrul 'khor gyis 'gro bar bya'o //
analyzed: shing bzo ba'i 'khor rnams tshogs pa dang mchod sbyin byed pa'i slob dpon dag dang lhan cig nags su 'khrul 'khor gyis 'gro bar bya'o //
translated: Together with the assembled group of carpenters and the officiating priests, they should go to the forest with the machine.

original: nags tshal dang nye bar slebs pa'i dus su bdag nyid las thams cad pa'i gzugs su brtags shing bsams te /
analyzed: nags tshal dang nye bar slebs pa'i dus su bdag nyid las thams cad pa'i gzugs su brtags shing bsams te /
translated: When he arrives near the forest, he should imagine and visualize himself in the form of the all-accomplishing [Vajrasattva].

original: rkang pa g-yas mdun du byas nas shar dang byang gi phyogs su gdong phyogs pa'i slob dpon nags tshal gyi phyogs su rab tu zhugs te /
analyzed: rkang pa g-yas mdun du byas nas shar dang byang gi phyogs su gdong phyogs pa'i slob dpon nags tshal gyi phyogs su rab tu zhugs te /
translated: With his right foot forward, facing east or north, the master should enter the forest.

original: lo nyis brgya ma lon pa'i shing rnams ni nye bar mi blang ngo //
analyzed: lo nyis brgya ma lon pa'i shing rnams ni nye bar mi blang ngo //
translated: He should not take trees that are less than two hundred years old.

original: de la shing rnams ni dvi ke sha ra dang / m'a l'u ra dang / titta s'a ra dang / lha'i shing dang / sing lding dang / gamb'a ri dang / sbrang rtsi can dang / mya ngan med dang / ba ku la dang / rnam par rgyal byed dang /

translated: The trees are the dvik·π£ara, the mƒÅlu, the titta, the divine tree, the si·πÉha, the gambhƒ´ra, the honey tree, the a≈õoka, the bakula, and the vijaya.

analyzed: sa'i tsandan dang / tsamba ka dang / tsandan dang / kidshu ka dang / pa l'a sha dang / pitstshi la dang / tsa la da la dang / sha ra s'a la dang / t'a la dang / granthi la dang / aa rdzu na dang /
translated: sandalwood, champak, sandalwood, ki·π£ku, pƒÅla≈õa, pi·π£·π≠acƒ´la, candala, ≈õara≈õƒÅla, tƒÅla, granthi, arjuna,üîΩjambu, bandhu, rohinƒ´, and so forth. Having well examined those trees that have arisen in those places, the master endowed with the yoga of all activities, full of enthusiasm,

analyzed: dzambu dang / bhandi la dang / ro hi n'i la sogs pa shing bzang po du ma gang dang gang du skyes pa'i shing de dag legs par brtags te mtshan mo'i dus su las thams cad pa'i rnal 'byor dang ldan pa'i slob dpon spro ba dang ldan pas shing bzo ba grogs dang bcas pa
translated: should, at night, together with his friends, the carpenters,

original: legs par bsrung ba byas te /üîΩnyer spyod lngas bla ma dang sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' dang phyogs kyi bdag po dang / nags kyi shing @263a * //
analyzed: legs par bsrung ba byas te / nyer spyod lngas bla ma dang sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' dang phyogs kyi bdag po dang / nags kyi shing @263a * //
translated: having performed the protection,

original: gi lha la sogs pa rnams yang dag par mchod de /
analyzed: gi lha la sogs pa rnams yang dag par mchod de /
translated: having made offerings to the gurus, buddhas, bodhisattvas, the lords of the directions, the gods of the forest trees, and so forth, with the five offerings,üîΩand having made a mandala in the place where the tree is to be cut,

original: phyogs kyi gtor ma yang byin nas shing bzo ba grogs dang bcas pa bza' ba dang / bca' ba dang / zas dang / skom dang / t'a z'u la la sogs pa rnams kyis yang dag par mgu par byas nas ;
analyzed: phyogs kyi gtor ma yang byin nas shing bzo ba grogs dang bcas pa bza' ba dang / bca' ba dang / zas dang / skom dang / t'a z'u la la sogs pa rnams kyis yang dag par mgu par byas nas ;
translated: Having given the torma to the directions, the carpenter and his assistants should be satisfied with food, drink, and so forth, and with tƒÅmb≈´la and so forth.

original: 'dod pa'i lha la bcom ldan che ge zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tshigs su bcad pa rnams kyis gsol ba btab pas thugs mnyes te /
analyzed: 'dod pa'i lha la bcom ldan che ge zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tshigs su bcad pa rnams kyis gsol ba btab pas thugs mnyes te /
translated: Having made a request with the verses beginning, ‚ÄúThe BhagavƒÅn, so and so,‚Äù and so forth, the deity of desire is pleased.

original: shing bzo ba grogs dang bcas pa dang lhan cig 'dod pa'i lha'i rnal 'byor dang zhi ba'i yid kyis nyal bar bya'o //
analyzed: shing bzo ba grogs dang bcas pa dang lhan cig 'dod pa'i lha'i rnal 'byor dang zhi ba'i yid kyis nyal bar bya'o //
translated: Together with the carpenter and his assistants, one should sleep with the yoga of the deity of desire and a peaceful mind.

original: de la rmi lam bzang po nges par mthong na legs par grub par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de la rmi lam bzang po nges par mthong na legs par grub par 'gyur ro //
translated: If one definitely sees a good dream, it will be accomplished well.

original: rmi lam ngan pa thams cad zhi ba'i sngags bzla bar bya'o //
analyzed: rmi lam ngan pa thams cad zhi ba'i sngags bzla bar bya'o //
translated: One should recite the mantra for pacifying all bad dreams.

original: de nas snga bar mchod pa thams cad dang yang dag par ldan pa'i slob dpon rnam par snang mdzad chen po'i rnal 'byor dang ldan pas der gnas pa'i shing gi lha mo'i gzugs kyi shing gi rgyal po yang dag par mchod par bya'o //
analyzed: de nas snga bar mchod pa thams cad dang yang dag par ldan pa'i slob dpon rnam par snang mdzad chen po'i rnal 'byor dang ldan pas der gnas pa'i shing gi lha mo'i gzugs kyi shing gi rgyal po yang dag par mchod par bya'o //
translated: Then, the master, endowed with the yoga of Great Vairocana, should, in the early morning, make offerings to the tree-king, in the form of the tree-goddess who resides there, endowed with all the offerings.

original: de la shing gi lha mo de rnams dang zhing skyong de rnams kyang 'di yin te /
analyzed: de la shing gi lha mo de rnams dang zhing skyong de rnams kyang 'di yin te /
translated: The tree-goddesses and the field-protectors are as follows:

analyzed: lha'i shing dang / dvi ke sha ra dang / tsampa ka dang / mya ngan med pa'i shing rnams la shing gi lha mo gsang ba ma'o //
translated: The secret goddess of the divine tree, the dvƒ´ka tree, the campaka tree, and the a≈õoka tree.

original: zhing skyong stobs po che'o //
analyzed: zhing skyong stobs po che'o //
translated: The field-protector is MahƒÅbala.

original: ne m'i dang / sh'a la dang / sha ra la'i shing rnams kyi ni 'jig rten gyi ma'o //
analyzed: ne m'i dang / sh'a la dang / sha ra la'i shing rnams kyi ni 'jig rten gyi ma'o //
translated: The worldly goddess of the neem tree, the ≈õƒÅla tree, and the ≈õara·πáa tree.

original: zhing skyong ri bo chen po'o //
analyzed: zhing skyong ri bo chen po'o //
translated: The field-protector is MahƒÅ≈õaila.

original: aa ru ra'i shing dang / ba ta dang / ra shing rnams kyi ni rna ba nyed ma'o //
analyzed: aa ru ra'i shing dang / ba ta dang / ra shing rnams kyi ni rna ba nyed ma'o //
translated: The ear-goddess of the myrobalan tree, the bata tree, and the ra tree.

original: zhing skyong shin tu stobs so //
analyzed: zhing skyong shin tu stobs so //
translated: The field-protector is MahƒÅbala.

original: tsu ta'i shing la ni aa mbi k'a'o //
analyzed: tsu ta'i shing la ni aa mbi k'a'o //
translated: On the cuta tree is Ambika.

original: zhing skyong stobs can no ;
analyzed: zhing skyong stobs can no ;
translated: The field protector is Powerful.

original: / ta la'i shing la bde byed ma'o //
analyzed: / ta la'i shing la bde byed ma'o //
translated: On the palm tree is Ramya.

original: zhing skyong skra gyen brdzes so //
analyzed: zhing skyong skra gyen brdzes so //
translated: The field protector is Hair Upturned.

original: kanda pa'i shing la bzhin bzang ma'o //
analyzed: kanda pa'i shing la bzhin bzang ma'o //
translated: On the kantaka tree is Subhadra.

original: zhing skyong dril bu chen po'o //
analyzed: zhing skyong dril bu chen po'o //
translated: The field protector is Great Bell.

original: ka ranydza la ni ka ranydza ra gnas ma'o //
analyzed: ka ranydza la ni ka ranydza ra gnas ma'o //
translated: On the karnikara tree is Karnikaravasa.

original: zhing skyong gtum pa'i dril bu'o //
analyzed: zhing skyong gtum pa'i dril bu'o //
translated: The field protector is Fierce Bell.

original: sbrang rtsi'i shing la dbang bskur ma'o //
analyzed: sbrang rtsi'i shing la dbang bskur ma'o //
translated: On the honey tree is Abhiseki.

original: gser shing la gtum mo'o //

translated: On the gold tree is Ca·πá·∏çƒÅlƒ´.

original: zhing skyong su dza ne t'a'o //

translated: The field protector is SujanetƒÅ.

original: shri go ra'i shing la dpal chen mo'o //
analyzed: shri go ra'i shing la dpal chen mo'o //
translated: On the ≈õrƒ´go tree is MahƒÅ≈õrƒ´.

original: zhing skyong me'i kha'o //
analyzed: zhing skyong me'i kha'o //
translated: The field protector is Fire Mouth.

original: de nas las dang rjes su mthun par shing gi lha mo rnams dang zhing skyong rnams kyi yang rnam pa bsgoms nas rang @263b rang gi sngags kyis mchod par bya'o //

original: gtsug lag khang gi rgyu yi phyir //
analyzed: gtsug lag khang gi rgyu yi phyir //
translated: For the sake of the temple,

original: bdag ni ljon shing gcad par 'dod //
analyzed: bdag ni ljon shing gcad par 'dod //
translated: I wish to cut down the tree.

original: da ni khyed rnams shing gzhan la //
analyzed: da ni khyed rnams shing gzhan la //
translated: Now you should dwell in another tree

original: gnas te bdag la bzod par mdzod //
analyzed: gnas te bdag la bzod par mdzod //
translated: and forgive me.

original: ces bya ba'i tshigs bcad lan gsum du brjod de //
analyzed: ces bya ba'i tshigs bcad lan gsum du brjod de //
translated: Recite this verse three times.

original: shing la gnas pa'i lha la gsol te /
analyzed: shing la gnas pa'i lha la gsol te /
translated: Request the deity dwelling in the tree.

original: de nas me tog la sogs pas legs par mchod de /
analyzed: de nas me tog la sogs pas legs par mchod de /
translated: Then make offerings with flowers and so forth.

original: shing gzhan la gnas par bsam par bya'o //
analyzed: shing gzhan la gnas par bsam par bya'o //
translated: Imagine the tree deities dwelling in another tree.

original: de nas bsrung ba'i ched du rma bya chen mo bklag par bya'o //
analyzed: de nas bsrung ba'i ched du rma bya chen mo bklag par bya'o //
translated: Then, for the sake of protection, recite MahƒÅmƒÅy≈´rƒ´.

original: de nas las thams cad pa'i gzugs can gyi shing bzo ba gser dang ras dang t'a mb'u la la sogs pa rnams kyis yongs su mgu bar byas te /
analyzed: de nas las thams cad pa'i gzugs can gyi shing bzo ba gser dang ras dang t'a mb'u la la sogs pa rnams kyis yongs su mgu bar byas te /
translated: Then, the carpenter who is the form of all activity, having been fully pleased with gold, cloth, tƒÅmb≈´la, and so forth,

original: dgra sta sbrang rtsis byugs te dge ba'i sems kyis shing bzo ba lag pa g-yas pa gyen du phyogs pa dang / kha byang shar du bltas te nyi ma la bltas nas shing bcad par bya'o //
analyzed: dgra sta sbrang rtsis byugs te dge ba'i sems kyis shing bzo ba lag pa g-yas pa gyen du phyogs pa dang / kha byang shar du bltas te nyi ma la bltas nas shing bcad par bya'o //
translated: The woodcutter should cut the wood with a virtuous mind, his right hand raised, facing north-east, and looking at the sun.

original: der yang dge ba dang mi dge ba'i mtshan ma blta bar bya ste mi dge ba'i mtshan ma byung na spang bar bya zhing /
analyzed: der yang dge ba dang mi dge ba'i mtshan ma blta bar bya ste mi dge ba'i mtshan ma byung na spang bar bya zhing /
translated: There, he should look for the signs of virtue and non-virtue. If the sign of non-virtue arises, he should abandon it.

original: dge ba'i mtshan ma byung na gzung bar bya'o //
analyzed: dge ba'i mtshan ma byung na gzung bar bya'o //
translated: If the sign of virtue arises, he should take it.üîΩIf the wood falls to the north, then at that time, the sacrificer will obtain wealth and the accomplishment of his work.

original: gal te shing byang phyogs su lhung bar gyur na de'i tshe mchod sbyin byed pa la nor dang las kyi dngos grub tu 'gyur ro //üîΩdbang ldan gyi phyogs su lhung na rig pa dang ye shes kun du 'gro bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te shing byang phyogs su lhung bar gyur na de'i tshe mchod sbyin byed pa la nor dang las kyi dngos grub tu 'gyur ro // dbang ldan gyi phyogs su lhung na rig pa dang ye shes kun du 'gro bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If it falls to the north-east, then he will obtain the accomplishment of his work.üîΩIf it falls to the east, then he will obtain the accomplishment of his work.üîΩIf it falls to the south-east, then he will obtain the accomplishment of his work.üîΩIf it falls to the south, then he will obtain the accomplishment of his work.üîΩIf it falls to the south-west, then he will obtain the accomplishment of his work.üîΩIf it falls to the west, then he will obtain the accomplishment of his work.

original: gal te dbang po'i phyogs su shing lhung na de'i tshe @264a * //üîΩdpal dang 'byor pa dang rgyas par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te dbang po'i phyogs su shing lhung na de'i tshe @264a * //üîΩdpal dang 'byor pa dang rgyas par 'gyur ro //
translated: If it falls to the north-west, then he will obtain the accomplishment of his work.üîΩIf it falls to the nadir, then he will obtain the accomplishment of his work.üîΩIf it falls to the zenith, then he will obtain the accomplishment of his work.

original: gal te shing gzhan rnam par nyid pa'i bar du lhung bar gyur pa de'i tshe dge ba dang bde ba nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te shing gzhan rnam par nyid pa'i bar du lhung bar gyur pa de'i tshe dge ba dang bde ba nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: If it falls to the other trees until it is exhausted, then it will be virtuous and happy.

original: gal te shing gzhan ma bcom par lhung na mchod sbyin byed pa la 'jigs pa chen por 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te shing gzhan ma bcom par lhung na mchod sbyin byed pa la 'jigs pa chen por 'gyur ro //
translated: If it falls to another tree without being exhausted, then it will be a great danger to the sacrificer.

original: me dang bden bral dang gshin rje dang chu dang rlung gi phyogs rnams su lhung na grangs bzhin du me'i 'jigs pa dang nad dang 'chi ba dang chu dang rlung gi 'jigs pa 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: me dang bden bral dang gshin rje dang chu dang rlung gi phyogs rnams su lhung na grangs bzhin du me'i 'jigs pa dang nad dang 'chi ba dang chu dang rlung gi 'jigs pa 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If it falls to the directions of fire, the south, Yama, water, and wind, then respectively there will be the danger of fire, illness, death, water, and wind.

original: bskyod pa na sgra mi gsal ba ring du grag cing lhung na mchod sbyin byed pa po la sdug bsngal gyi mtshan mar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bskyod pa na sgra mi gsal ba ring du grag cing lhung na mchod sbyin byed pa po la sdug bsngal gyi mtshan mar 'gyur ro //
translated: If it falls while shaking, making an unclear sound, and far away, then it will be a sign of suffering for the sacrificer.

original: gcod pa'i dus su gal te rnga mo dang rta dang ces spyang dang bong bu dang sbrul dang phag dang bya rog la sogs pa gdug pa'i 'dab chags mthong bar gyur na de'i tshe des par gsad pa dang bcing ba dang bgegs du ma 'byung bar 'gyur ro
analyzed: gcod pa'i dus su gal te rnga mo dang rta dang ces spyang dang bong bu dang sbrul dang phag dang bya rog la sogs pa gdug pa'i 'dab chags mthong bar gyur na de'i tshe des par gsad pa dang bcing ba dang bgegs du ma 'byung bar 'gyur ro
translated: If, at the time of the sacrifice, he sees a camel, a horse, a wolf, an ass, a snake, a pig, a crow, or other such evil birds, then he should know that there will be many obstacles, such as death and bondage.

original: // gal te shing las khrag 'dzag na de'i tshe mchod sbyin byed pa 'chi bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: // gal te shing las khrag 'dzag na de'i tshe mchod sbyin byed pa 'chi bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If blood flows from the tree, then the sacrificer will die.

original: zho dang mar dang sbrang rtsi dang 'o ma 'dzag na gsad pa dang bcing ba la sogs pa'i 'jigs pa 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: zho dang mar dang sbrang rtsi dang 'o ma 'dzag na gsad pa dang bcing ba la sogs pa'i 'jigs pa 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If milk, curd, ghee, honey, or water flows from the tree, then he should know that there will be danger of death and bondage.

original: 'on kyang shing rnams la rang bzhin pa'i mngar ba dang tshab dang kha ba dang bska ba'i bcud 'byung ba de la ni nyes pa med do //
analyzed: 'on kyang shing rnams la rang bzhin pa'i mngar ba dang tshab dang kha ba dang bska ba'i bcud 'byung ba de la ni nyes pa med do //
translated: However, if the tree exudes its natural sap, which is sweet, sour, bitter, or astringent, then there is no fault.

original: sbal pa le brgan gyi mdog can byung na des ni nad 'byung ba rjes su dpag par bya'o //
analyzed: sbal pa le brgan gyi mdog can byung na des ni nad 'byung ba rjes su dpag par bya'o //
translated: If a red frog appears, then he should infer that there will be illness.

original: de bzhin du shing gi khong nas bya ba mdog ser skya byung na des chom rkun gyi 'jigs pa dang sv'a sha'i nad 'byung bar rjes su dpag par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du shing gi khong nas bya ba mdog ser skya byung na des chom rkun gyi 'jigs pa dang sv'a sha'i nad 'byung bar rjes su dpag par bya'o //
translated: Likewise, if a yellow-tinged creature emerges from the tree, one should infer that there will be danger from thieves and the disease of leprosy.

original: shing gi bar nas rtsangs pa mdog ser po byung na des ni nor nyams par rjes su dpag par bya'o //
analyzed: shing gi bar nas rtsangs pa mdog ser po byung na des ni nor nyams par rjes su dpag par bya'o //
translated: If a yellow lizard emerges from the tree, one should infer that there will be loss of wealth.

original: de'i khong nas khyim gyi rtsangs pa phug ron gyi mdog can byung na des mchod sbyin byed pa dbul por 'gyur bar rjes su dpag par bya'o //
analyzed: de'i khong nas khyim gyi rtsangs pa phug ron gyi mdog can byung na des mchod sbyin byed pa dbul por 'gyur bar rjes su dpag par bya'o //
translated: If a house lizard the color of a pigeon emerges from it, one should infer that the sacrificer will become poor.

original: kha dog dmar po'i na k'u ka l'a sha byung na des ni nad 'byung bar rjes su dpag par bya'o //
analyzed: kha dog dmar po'i na k'u ka l'a sha byung na des ni nad 'byung bar rjes su dpag par bya'o //
translated: If a red-colored nƒÅkulas emerges, one should infer that there will be disease.

original: khong nas sbrul sngo bsangs byung na des kyang nor zad pa nyid do //
analyzed: khong nas sbrul sngo bsangs byung na des kyang nor zad pa nyid do //
translated: If a blue snake emerges from it, one should infer that there will be loss of wealth.

original: kha tr'u'i mdog can gyi chu byung na des ni chu'i 'jigs pa nyid rjes su dpag par bya'o //
analyzed: kha tr'u'i mdog can gyi chu byung na des ni chu'i 'jigs pa nyid rjes su dpag par bya'o //
translated: If a water creature the color of a parrot emerges, one should infer that there will be danger from water.

original: gdugs dang / rgyal mtshan dang / g-yung drung dang / @264b dpal be'u dang / bum pa dang / rnga yab dang / 'khor lo dang / padma dang / dga' ba 'khyil pa dang / sdong ris dang ku sha rnams ni mtshan ma bzang po ste de lta bu la sogs pa dge ba dang mi dge ba'i mtshan ma rnams yongs su shes par byas nas shing gcad par bya'o //
analyzed: gdugs dang / rgyal mtshan dang / g-yung drung dang / @264b dpal be'u dang / bum pa dang / rnga yab dang / 'khor lo dang / padma dang / dga' ba 'khyil pa dang / sdong ris dang ku sha rnams ni mtshan ma bzang po ste de lta bu la sogs pa dge ba dang mi dge ba'i mtshan ma rnams yongs su shes par byas nas shing gcad par bya'o //
translated: The good signs are the parasol, the victory banner, the swastika, the endless knot, the vase, the yak-tail fan, the wheel, the lotus, the spiral, and the ku≈õa grass. Having understood these and other good and bad signs, one should cut the wood.

original: de nas shing de dag yang dag par rnam par phye nas rtsa ba dang sked pa dang rtse mo'i mtshams rnams phye ste cha gcig gis lhag pa'i cha bcu'i tshad du bya ste /
analyzed: de nas shing de dag yang dag par rnam par phye nas rtsa ba dang sked pa dang rtse mo'i mtshams rnams phye ste cha gcig gis lhag pa'i cha bcu'i tshad du bya ste /
translated: Then, having properly divided the trees, one should divide them into sections of the root, the middle, and the top.

original: shing rnams ji lta bar nags kyi 'khrul 'khor yang de bzhin te mchod rten dang bim ba la sogs pa'i phyir du nags kyi 'khrul 'khor de rnams kyis drang bar bya'o /
analyzed: shing rnams ji lta bar nags kyi 'khrul 'khor yang de bzhin te mchod rten dang bim ba la sogs pa'i phyir du nags kyi 'khrul 'khor de rnams kyis drang bar bya'o /
translated: Just as with the trees, so also with the forest machine. For the sake of the st≈´pa and the bimba, one should draw those forest machines.

original: // / rdo ba yang shis pa rnams gzung bar bya zhing mi shis pa rnams spang bar bya'o //
analyzed: // / rdo ba yang shis pa rnams gzung bar bya zhing mi shis pa rnams spang bar bya'o //
translated: One should take the auspicious stones and abandon the inauspicious ones.

original: de la ri'i ljongs dang ngam grog dang chu 'gram la sogs par gnas pa'i rdo ba mkhregs pa dang sra ba dang dri zhim pa dang shin tu reg na mnyen pa dang dri nga ba med cing 'jam pa dang snum pas ni tshe dang ldan no //
analyzed: de la ri'i ljongs dang ngam grog dang chu 'gram la sogs par gnas pa'i rdo ba mkhregs pa dang sra ba dang dri zhim pa dang shin tu reg na mnyen pa dang dri nga ba med cing 'jam pa dang snum pas ni tshe dang ldan no //
translated: Here, the stone that is firm, hard, fragrant, very soft to the touch, and smooth, without bad smell, is auspicious for longevity.

original: 'di la shis pa gnyis te dkar po dang ser po dang dmar po dang ljang gu dag dang / rdo ba nag po la gal te ri mo dkar po phra mo dang thig le dang ldan pa de'i tshe blon dang ldan pa dang / bza' mi'i rgyud dang rigs dang rgyal srid dang nor dang 'bangs rnams la shis so //
analyzed: 'di la shis pa gnyis te dkar po dang ser po dang dmar po dang ljang gu dag dang / rdo ba nag po la gal te ri mo dkar po phra mo dang thig le dang ldan pa de'i tshe blon dang ldan pa dang / bza' mi'i rgyud dang rigs dang rgyal srid dang nor dang 'bangs rnams la shis so //
translated: There are two kinds of auspicious stones: white, yellow, red, and green, and black. If the black stone has fine white lines and dots, then it is auspicious for the family, lineage, kingdom, wealth, and subjects.

original: steng dang byang dang dbang ldan dang shar gyi phyogs su gdong phyogs pas ni grangs bzhin du mkha' spyod kyi dngos grub dang skye bo dang nor dang rigs rgyud 'phel lo //
analyzed: steng dang byang dang dbang ldan dang shar gyi phyogs su gdong phyogs pas ni grangs bzhin du mkha' spyod kyi dngos grub dang skye bo dang nor dang rigs rgyud 'phel lo //
translated: Facing upward, north, northeast, and east, respectively, they grant the powers of space travel, increase of people, wealth, and family line.

original: thar pa dang mngon par 'dod pa'i dngos grub sbyin pa'i rdo ba rnams gzung bar bya'o //
analyzed: thar pa dang mngon par 'dod pa'i dngos grub sbyin pa'i rdo ba rnams gzung bar bya'o //
translated: One should take the stones that grant the powers of liberation and of whatever is desired.

original: shin tu 'jam pa'i gzong gis bsnun pa na bye ma dang bcas pa dang // rtsub pa dang bral ba dang gog sgra can gyi rdo ba rgan po 'di dag yongs su spang ngo //
analyzed: shin tu 'jam pa'i gzong gis bsnun pa na bye ma dang bcas pa dang // rtsub pa dang bral ba dang gog sgra can gyi rdo ba rgan po 'di dag yongs su spang ngo //
translated: When struck with a very smooth chisel, if they make a sound with sand, are free from roughness, and are old stones, one should reject them.

original: de ltar shis pa dang mi shes pa'i rdo ba rnams shes par byas nas shis pa'i rdo ba rnams pa yi rnam lngas byugs te dri bzang po'i chus khrus byas nas dri la sogs pa rnams kyis rgyas pa'i sems kyis mngon par mchod de shing gi skabs su
analyzed: de ltar shis pa dang mi shes pa'i rdo ba rnams shes par byas nas shis pa'i rdo ba rnams pa yi rnam lngas byugs te dri bzang po'i chus khrus byas nas dri la sogs pa rnams kyis rgyas pa'i sems kyis mngon par mchod de shing gi skabs su
translated: Having thus understood the auspicious and inauspicious stones, one should anoint the auspicious ones with the five products of the cow, wash them with scented water, and worship them with perfumes and so forth, with a mind full of faith.

original: bshad pa'i las rnams thams cad 'dir yang bya'o //
analyzed: bshad pa'i las rnams thams cad 'dir yang bya'o //
translated: All the rites explained in the chapter on the tree should be performed here as well.

original: de nas grong khyer du 'jug pa'i @265a * //
analyzed: de nas grong khyer du 'jug pa'i @265a * //
translated: Then, when entering the city,

original: dus su shing rnams dang / rdo ba rnams rgyal po'i skyes bu rnams kyis rgyas pa'i sems kyis drang bar bya zhing snga ma bzhin du mar me dang sil snyan sna tshogs kyi sgra dang ca co dang bcas te shin tu gus pa dang bcas pas zhugs te /
analyzed: dus su shing rnams dang / rdo ba rnams rgyal po'i skyes bu rnams kyis rgyas pa'i sems kyis drang bar bya zhing snga ma bzhin du mar me dang sil snyan sna tshogs kyi sgra dang ca co dang bcas te shin tu gus pa dang bcas pas zhugs te /
translated: the trees and stones should be led in with a generous mind by the king's men, and, as before, with various lamps and musical sounds and chatter, and with great respect, they should enter.

original: rgya che zhing mnyam pa'i sar bkod de padma'i dbus su gzhag par bya'o //
analyzed: rgya che zhing mnyam pa'i sar bkod de padma'i dbus su gzhag par bya'o //
translated: They should be placed on a level, spacious site, in the middle of a lotus.

original: gtsug lag khang sogs bzhengs pa la nye bar mkho ba'i sa brtag pa dang shing dang rdo ba'i cho ga 'di sngags kyi gzhung lugs che ba zhig gis dum bur mngon no //
analyzed: gtsug lag khang sogs bzhengs pa la nye bar mkho ba'i sa brtag pa dang shing dang rdo ba'i cho ga 'di sngags kyi gzhung lugs che ba zhig gis dum bur mngon no //
translated: This examination of the earth and the ritual of the trees and stones necessary for the construction of temples and so forth is clearly a fragment of a great scriptural tradition of mantra.

original: 'di'i rgya dpe gnyal gyi phyogs nas rnyed de lha dang bcas pa'i skye dgu mtha' dag gi gtsug gi nor bus zhabs rten gyi padma la phyag byas pa'i 'dren pa dam pa chos kyi rje rin po che zhva dmar cod pan 'dzin pa bzhi pa'i zhal snga nas
analyzed: 'di'i rgya dpe gnyal gyi phyogs nas rnyed de lha dang bcas pa'i skye dgu mtha' dag gi gtsug gi nor bus zhabs rten gyi padma la phyag byas pa'i 'dren pa dam pa chos kyi rje rin po che zhva dmar cod pan 'dzin pa bzhi pa'i zhal snga nas
translated: The Indian text was found in the Nyal region. The great guide, the precious lord of dharma, the one who holds the crown of the fourth Shamarpa, who is the crest jewel of all living beings, including the gods, was requested to translate it by prostrating to the lotus feet of the one who holds the crown of the fourth Shamarpa.

original: bsgyur cig ces gsung pa bzhin du zha lu lo ts'a bas dpal sne'u gdong rtser bsgyur ba'o /
analyzed: bsgyur cig ces gsung pa bzhin du zha lu lo ts'a bas dpal sne'u gdong rtser bsgyur ba'o /
translated: In accordance with his statement, it was translated by the Zhalu translator at glorious Neu Dongtse.
